data.title: City Council Members
data.text:
Dan Saracki, Mayor

dsaracki@myoldsmar.com

Phone Number(s): 813-763-0421 or 813-749-1115

Term Ends: March 2025

Dan has served on Oldsmar City Council since 2015 and was elected Mayor in 2022. He is a member of the Florida League of Mayors and serves on the Board of Directors At Large. Dan is a member of the Suncoast League of Cities and served as their President from 2020-2022 and has been a member of various committees including Legislative, Regional Advocacy Team, and the Suncoast League Delegation Nominating Committee. As a member of the Florida League of Cities (FLC), Dan has served as a member of various committees including the Legislative & Advocacy Committee, DC FAST Fly-In, the Resolutions Committee, the Utilities Natural Resources & Public Works Committee and he served as the Municipal Administration Committee Chair in 2019. Dan received the Gold Certificate of Excellence from the Certified Program for Elected Municipal Officials by the FLC University. He is a graduate of the Institute for Elected Municipal Officials (IEMO), classes I through IV. and has been awarded the FLC Home Rule Hero award consecutively since 2018. Dan serves on the Pinellas Suncoast Transit Authority as Vice-Chair and he is on the Executive Committee, the Legislative Committee for State and Federal, and the Finance Committee. He is a member of the Pinellas County Mayor’s Council and was recently elected Secretary in April, 2023. Dan serves on the EMS Advisory Council and has been a Board Member since 2022. He has held various leadership roles, such as serving on the East Lake Oaks Community Development District Board and chairing the Leisure Services Advisory Board. Dan is also involved in organizations like the Oldsmar Cares Board of Directors and the Oldsmar Historical Society, where he serves as Treasurer. Additionally, Saracki has served on boards like the Tampa Bay Regional Planning Council. Dan has been married to Paula for 32 years and has three daughters – Danielle, Deanna, and Dana; and five grandchildren – Hannah, Alexzander, Colton, Daisy, and Vardan. He enjoys bike riding on Oldsmar’s many trails and playing ball hockey at Oldsmar’s Lightning Made rink.

Steve Graber, Vice Mayor, Seat 1

sgraber@myoldsmar.com

Phone Number: 813-763-0427

Term Ends: March 2027

Steve Graber currently serves as Vice Mayor. This is his second term on Seat 1 of the Oldsmar City Council. Steve is focused on the continued growth of Oldsmar through the development of downtown, increased recreational options, and the development of a community center for the arts. He currently serves as Chairman of the Board of Trustees for the Florida Municipal Investment Trust. Previously, he served as Oldsmar's representative to the Tampa Bay Regional Planning Council. Steve is a member of the Oldsmar Historical Society and Friends of the Oldsmar Library. Prior to being elected to council, Steve graduated from the 2019 Janice Miller Citizen’s Academy and served on multiple advisory boards including the Board of Adjustment, the Ordinance Review Committee, and the Forward Pinellas Citizens Advisory Committee. Steve is in-house counsel for a title insurance company and received his bachelor’s degree from Florida State University and his law degree from the University of Dayton School of Law. Steve and his wife, Kelly, are raising their young family in Oldsmar. In their spare time, they enjoy attending events at local parks and walking the Oldsmar Trail, dining at local restaurants, and visiting with family and friends.

Andrew Knapp, Seat 3

aknapp@myoldsmar.com

Phone Number: 813-763-0451

Term Ends: March 2027

Andrew Knapp is a third-generation resident of Oldsmar. He was first elected to Seat 3 of the City council in 2020 in a Special Election. He is now in his second full term of office and has served as Vice Mayor. Additionally, he represents Oldsmar on the Forward Pinellas Board, Tampa Bay Regional Planning Council, Tampa bay Regional Resiliency Coalition and the PIE Noise Abatement Task Force. Andrew is actively involved in his community, previously serving as the President of his neighborhood's HOA and on various city volunteer boards and committees, including the Code Enforcement Board, the Firefighter's Pension Board and the Ordinance Review Committee. He is a graduate of the Janice Miller Oldsmar Citizen's Academy and a charter member of the Oldsmar VFW Auxiliary 12186. Professionally, Andrew works as a Manufacturing Engineer Manager at MicroLumen, an Oldsmar-based company specializing in cardiovascular medical tubing. Outside of his civic and professional engagements, Andrew enjoys traveling, experiencing global cultures, and participating in activities like running, cycling, and learning new hobbies such as computer programming and homebrewing. Most importantly, he loves spending the majority of his free time with his wife, Nicole, their two children, Leona and Henry, and their families near and far.

Sandie Grimes, Seat 2

sgrimes@myoldsmar.com

Phone Number: 813-763-0433

Term Ends: August 2024

Sandie Grimes has been a resident of Oldsmar for over 25 years. During that time, she has been very involved in the Oldsmar community. She has served on the City’s Code Enforcement Board for the past 22 years, the Firefighter’s Pension Board of Trustees, served as chairperson for the 2021 Charter Review Committee, and as co-chairperson for the 2020 Economic Recovery Task Force. In 2020, Sandie was honored to be named Oldsmar’s “Citizen of the Year” and was recognized in 2005 as “Volunteer of the Year” by the Upper Tampa Bay Chamber of Commerce. She is the past Chairman of the Board and current Board Member of the Upper Tampa Bay Chamber of Commerce, past Chairman and Board Member of HCA Town & Country Community Hospital, and past President of the Pinellas Association of Insurance Agents. She is also a Graduate of Leadership Pinellas/Class of 2009. Sandie is currently Managing Director with Stahl & Associates Insurance a Higginbotham Partner, providing over 30 years of experience in property, casualty, life, and health insurance. She received her Bachelor of Arts degree from Eckerd College. When not working or volunteering, she loves attending Tampa Bay Lightning games - she and her husband Steve are huge fans and season ticket holders. Sandie is honored to be appointed to the City Council and looks forward to serving the City of Oldsmar through August 2024.

Katie Gannon, Seat 4

kgannon@myoldsmar.com

Phone Number: 813-763-0468

Term Ends: March 2025

Katie Gannon is serving her second term on Oldsmar City Council at Seat 4. She has also twice served as the city’s Vice Mayor. As an Oldsmar resident for over 30 years, Katie is passionate about working with residents and key stakeholders to bring new businesses and development to our city, while preserving our historic roots. She is an advocate for fiscal responsibility, transparency, and resiliency. Katie is committed to representing the interests of all of Oldsmar’s residents, including families, veterans, young adults, professionals, and retirees. Katie led the effort to reestablish the city’s Ordinance Review Committee and Charter review process and encouraged the City’s re-branding effort.Katie currently serves as Oldsmar’s representative on the Forward Pinellas School Transportation Safety Committee. She previously served as a board member and officer for Leadership Pinellas. She is currently a member of the Oldsmar Historical Society, Friends of the Oldsmar Library, the Woman’s Club of Oldsmar, and Oldsmar Friends of the Arts. She is also a member of Oldsmar’s VFW Auxiliary 12186. Prior to being elected, Katie served on the city’s Leisure Services Advisory Board and is a 2018 graduate of Oldsmar’s Janice Miller Citizen’s Academy. Katie is a member of the Florida Bar and an attorney licensed to practice before all Florida state and federal courts. She is an alumnus of the University of Florida. She enjoys spending time with her family at local events and in the many parks, Oldsmar has to offer. Both of her children attend Oldsmar Elementary School where Katie is a member of the PTA and annually participates in the Adopt-a-Class Program.
